intro: Amaranthus angustifolius subsp. graecizans, commonly known as Greek amaranth, is a species native to the Mediterranean region. It is an annual herb that grows up to 1 meter in height, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that develop into spiny, three-angled capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional cuisines.
